paper_metadata.title: Impact Evaluation of BISP Cash Transfer Program

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: BISP provides unconditional cash assistance to more than 5 million families. The quarterly stipend at present is Rs. 6000 per household.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: For poverty, we look at the impact of the BISP cash transfer on both headcount ratio and the multidimensional index. | The analysis shows no impact of the cash transfer on various welfare indicators related to consumption expenditures at the national level. | The analysis reveals that the BISP beneficiaries continue to face the issue of high food insecurity
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: Fuzzy Regression Discontinuity Design (RDD) is applied to the 2019 cross-sectional data, and difference-in-discontinuity method is applied for a panel analysis

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Program budget allocation increased from Rs. 34 billion in 2008-09 to Rs. 180 billion in 2019-20
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: It was Rs. 34 billion in 2008-09, Rs. 70 billion in 2013-14 and Rs. 180 billion in 2019-20.

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: We use the BISP's impact evaluation survey to measure the welfare impact of its unconditional cash transfer.
evidence_citations.country_citation: The emergence of BISP has improved the overall spending on the social safety net in Pakistan.
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: BISP provides unconditional cash assistance to more than 5 million families.
